evidence.text: ORDER GRANTING TEMPORARY RESTRAINING ORDER AND ORDER TO SHOW CAUSE WHY A PRELIMINARY INJUNCTION SHOULD NOT ISSUE granting 5 Motion for TRO; with respect to 5 Motion for Preliminary Injunction. ORDERED that the motion for a Temporary Restraining Order is GRANTED.

extracted.value: Granted Temporary Restraining Order (TRO) for Plaintiffs (motion 5) on June 4, 2025.

evidence.text: ORDER TO SHOW CAUSE WHY A PRELIMINARY INJUNCTION SHOULD NOT ISSUE granting 5 Motion for TRO; with respect to 5 Motion for Preliminary Injunction.

extracted.value: Court ordered show cause why a preliminary injunction should not issue on June 4, 2025.

evidence.text: Defendants, their agents, and all persons acting in concert or participation with Defendants are ENJOINED from enforcing, implementing, maintaining or giving effect to the elimination of the Job Corps program, including the stop work orders and termination and non‑renewal notices delivered to Job Corps center operators starting May 29, 2025; from issuing, enforcing, implementing, maintaining or giving effect to any shutdown tasks, job terminations, or student removals; and from taking any further action to eliminate the Job Corps program without Congressional authorization.

extracted.value: Court enjoined defendants from enforcing, implementing, maintaining or giving effect to the elimination of the Job Corps program on June 4, 2025.

evidence.text: It is further ORDERED that the requirement that Plaintiffs post security pursuant to Federal Rule of Civil Procedure 65(c) is waived.

extracted.value: Court waived the requirement that Plaintiffs post security pursuant to Federal Rule of Civil Procedure 65(c) on June 4, 2025.

evidence.text: ORDER FOR ADMISSION PRO HAC VICE granting 26 Motion for Amy Jeffress to Appear Pro Hac Vice. The motion of Amy Jeffress for admission to practice pro hac vice in the above‑captioned action is granted.

extracted.value: Granted admission pro hac vice to Amy Jeffress on June 11, 2025.

evidence.text: ORDER FOR ADMISSION PRO HAC VICE granting 27 Motion for Minahil Khan to Appear Pro Hac Vice. The motion of Minahil Khan for admission to practice pro hac vice in the above‑captioned action is granted.

extracted.value: Granted admission pro hac vice to Minahil Khan on June 11, 2025.

evidence.text: ORDER FOR ADMISSION PRO HAC VICE granting 35 Motion for Tiffinay Barker Pagni to Appear Pro Hac Vice. Upon motion of Tiffinay Barker Pagni, for admission to practice Pro Hac Vice in the above‑captioned action is granted.

extracted.value: Granted admission pro hac vice to Tiffinay Barker Pagni on June 11, 2025.

evidence.text: ORDER granting 28 Letter Motion for Leave to File Document. For the reasons set forth in the Amici States June 10th letter, and because their request is unopposed by the Parties, the Amici States request to file an amicus brief is hereby GRANTED.

extracted.value: Granted letter motion for leave to file document (amici brief) on June 11, 2025.

evidence.text: ORDER FOR ADMISSION TO PRACTICE PRO HAC VICE granting 35 Motion for Tiffinay Barker Pagni to Appear Pro Hac Vice. Upon motion of Tiffinay Barker Pagni, for admission to practice Pro Hac Vice in the above‑captioned action is granted.

extracted.value: Granted admission pro hac vice to Tiffinay Barker Pagni on June 12, 2025.

evidence.text: ORDER FOR ADMISSION PRO HAC VICE granting 48 Motion for Carla Siegel to Appear Pro Hac Vice. The motion of Carla Siegel for admission to practice Pro Hac Vice in the above‑captioned action is granted.

extracted.value: Granted admission pro hac vice to Carla Siegel on June 16, 2025.

evidence.text: ORDER granting 51 Letter Motion for Leave to File Document. The Court is in receipt of Defendants letter dated June 16, 2025 seeking leave to file a Supplemental Declaration and Notice of Supplemental Authority in further support of their Opposition to Plaintiffs Motion for a Preliminary Injunction (Dkt. No. 51). Defendants request is hereby GRANTED.

extracted.value: Granted letter motion for leave to file supplemental declaration and notice of supplemental authority (Defendants letter) on June 16, 2025.

evidence.text: As discussed at the hearing, the TRO granted on June 4, 2025 is hereby extended until and including June 25, 2025.

extracted.value: Extended TRO until June 25, 2025 on June 17, 2025.

evidence.text: The Court hereby orders the parties to meet and confer and file a joint status report by June 20, 2025.

extracted.value: Ordered parties to meet and confer and file a joint status report by June 20, 2025 on June 17, 2025.

evidence.text: Plaintiffs’ motion for a preliminary injunction is granted.

extracted.value: Granted Plaintiffs’ motion for a preliminary injunction on June 17, 2025.

evidence.text: Defendants’ request for an injunction limited to the parties in this action is granted in part.

extracted.value: Granted Defendants’ request for an injunction limited to the parties in this action (in part) on June 17, 2025.

evidence.text: Defendants’ request that Plaintiffs post bond for the injunction is granted.

extracted.value: Granted Defendants’ request that Plaintiffs post bond for the injunction on June 17, 2025.

evidence.text: Defendants’ request to stay this proceeding is denied.

extracted.value: Denied Defendants’ request to stay this proceeding on June 17, 2025.

evidence.text: Defendants' request for a tailored injunction is granted to the extent that this injunction may not supersede any contrary ruling by the district court in Cabrera v. U.S. Department of Labor, No. 25-cv-1909 (D.D.C. June 18, 2025) or any other federal district or circuit court.

extracted.value: Granted Defendants’ request for a tailored injunction to the extent that the injunction may not supersede any contrary ruling by the district court (Cabrera v. U.S. Department of Labor, No. 25-cv-1909, D.D.C. June 18, 2025) or any other federal district or circuit court, on June 17, 2025.
